summary: Email correspondence from defense attorney Laura Menninger to prosecutors regarding significant deficiencies in the discovery process in US v. Maxwell, specifically concerning the review and production of photographic and video evidence, including 'highly confidential' images from Epstein's devices. The email highlights technical problems, discrepancies in the number of images reported, and requests for proper access to evidence.

persons.name: Laura Menninger
persons.context: Attorney for Ghislaine Maxwell raising multiple issues with the government's discovery production, including unreadable files, metadata problems, and requests for access to 'highly confidential' images.

persons.name: Jeff Pagliuca
persons.context: Assistant US Attorney copied on the email correspondence regarding discovery deficiencies in the Maxwell case.

persons.name: Bobbi Sternheim
persons.context: Defense attorney for Ghislaine Maxwell copied on the email correspondence regarding discovery issues.

connections.description: Defense attorney corresponding with prosecutor about discovery issues in US v. Maxwell case.
Both are defense attorneys representing Ghislaine Maxwell, collaborating on discovery issues.

events.title: Discovery Review Meeting in NY
events.description: Meeting between defense and prosecution in New York where Laura Menninger requested to view all evidence including highly confidential material, and was shown hard-drives containing images from the case.

events.title: FBI Report on Digital Evidence
events.description: FBI report indicating approximately 33,747 non-confidential images and 895 highly confidential videos identified from CART-processed evidence from Epstein's devices.

events.title: Discovery Production
events.description: Government production of discovery materials to the defense in the Maxwell case.

keyFacts: Significant discrepancy in reported numbers of 'highly confidential' images: Prosecutors initially stated ~2,100 nude images from Epstein's devices, but an FBI report indicates ~33,747 NC images and 895 HC videos.
Defense reports thousands of unreadable photo files in discovery, with technical problems preventing proper review of evidence.
Defense requests production of hard-drives containing all 'highly confidential' material minus child pornography for proper defense preparation.
Email reveals extensive problems with metadata, file accessibility, and matching evidence to Bates numbers in the discovery process.
